Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a brown pottery wine-jar, the fabric is grey/red in section, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and faint traces of the remains of two lines of black-painted hieratic text referring in line one to Akhenaten by throne name (Neferkheperura), probably in a toponym.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393491) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393491)
